New Records: Tristan da Silva scored a career-high 25 points
Orlando Magic tied the franchise record for 3s in a quarter with 9
Key Match Events: Tristan da Silva scored a career-high 25 points
Goga Bitadze had 11 points and 13 rebounds
Cole Anthony matched a career high with 11 assists
Jalen Suggs left the game due to back spasms
Jakob Poeltl scored 25 points for the Raptors
Immanuel Quickley had 11 points and 11 assists
Four Magic players connected from deep in a 14-4 run late in the first quarter
Miscellaneous Highlights: Orlando shot 19 for 44 from 3-point range, improving to 18-6 this season when making 10 or more from distance
Toronto snapped an 11-game losing streak by beating Brooklyn on Wednesday but couldn’t maintain any momentum
The Raptors haven’t won consecutive games since home victories over Miami and Indiana on Dec. 1 and 3
The Raptors have only won back-to-back games twice this season
